chapter.title: Salix OS at a Glance
chapter.para: Salix OS is a Linux Distribution based on Slackware that retains full backwards compatibility with its illustrious parent. However, while the KISS principle that Slackware adheres to refers to the viewpoint of system design, Salix OS also applies it to the viewpoint of the end user.

listitem.para: With Salix tools to assist system management (See )
High quality package repositories with dependency support
Simple and fully localised system administration tools
Comes with a complete development environment

note.title: In Short, Salix OS is...
note.para: “Like a bonsai, Salix is small, light and the product of infinite care!”

section.title: Salix Editions
section.para: Salix OS comes in five different editions – Xfce, LXDE, KDE, Fluxbox and Ratpoison.

The choice is yours: with a streamlined Xfce desktop environment, elegant KDE 4.5.5 accompanied by a very rich collection of KDE centric software, minimalistic Fluxbox window manager, wickedly fast LXDE desktop or “say good-bye to the rodent” Ratpoison, all with the Salix look and feel!

section.para: Salix offers three software installation options: Full, Basic and Core, to meet your demands!
